title: Modern Slab Serifs with specific "a"
content:
Hi, I would like some help to identify these 2 slab serifs. Thanks in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065459im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tiramisu_4864.gif)
 - [Restaurant Woodmark](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065459/http:/maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=31+r+Coquilli%C3%A8re+75001+PARIS&sll=48.872111,2.349336&sspn=0.009795,0.026157&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=31+Rue+Coquilli%C3%A8re,+75001+Paris,+%C3%8Ele-de-France,+France&ll=48.864829,2.341563&spn=0,359.99673&z=19&layer=c&cbll=48.864234,2.341564&panoid=cvwrDj5VpNnIu34D7-ayVg&cbp=12,249.35,,3,-2.05)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065459im_/http:/typophile.com/files/hallow_5456_4262.jpg)
author: Ryuk

comments.content: The second one is a free font called Romeral by [Juan Pablo De Gregorio](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065459/http:/www.typies.blogspot.com/).

Jan, as usual, thank you very much for your time and your answer. Perfect match!  
For the first one, I just can't believe it's custom... It's a very small restaurant and if I clearly remember, they use this typeface for the rest of their collaterals (menus...).  
Similars or base font are welcome of course. Thanks.

The top one is very close to [Ink Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065459/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000132) at Veer. The alternate faces have very similar letters.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks a lot Stephen and Mike.  
The more I look at "tiramisu", the more I think it's a mix between regular and upright letters ("a", "m", "s" and "u" coming from the italic). FB Belizio would have been a start...
